metadata.title: CVE-2021-3658 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description: bluetoothd from bluez incorrectly saves adapters' Discoverable status whena device is powered down, and restores it when powered up. If a device ispowered down while discoverable, it will be discoverable when powered onagain. This could lead to inadvertent exposure of the bluetooth stack tophysically nearby attackers.

criterions.comment: bluez: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
